physical_examinations.relevant_findings: All 17 patients had functional visual fields. 82% had tubular fields; 71% exhibited nonphysiologic constriction on perimetry testing. Significant psychiatric, psychosocial, or other medical comorbidities were noted in 88% of patients. Follow-up data revealed 11 patients with initial FVL, of which 8 had stabilization and persistent nonphysiologic visual fields.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, 6 of 11 patients showed functional deterioration after their first visit with eventual stabilization or improvement noted at their last visit. Of the 11 patients with FVL at presentation, only 1 patient showed improvement, while 2 showed deterioration. For the 6 patients who developed FVL after initial presentation, all exhibited stabilization or improvement over time.
